James Cheesman Tue Apr 27, 2004  8:37 am
> You could also play around with java.awt.Robot

Why do that, when you could use one of the several excellent packages
built atop it, e.g. Abbot, Jemmy, JfcUnit? IIRC these all rely on
j.a.R to put UI events on the native queue (which is why they provide
real, not mock, testing of Java GUIs), but they relieve the user of
the need to find widget co-ordinates @ runtime, as well as other
useful high-level semantics. (Note that "Abbot" is short for "A Better
'Bot" :-) Don't play with j.a.R, start writing testcases!
